title: Add setup instructions to README
description:
## Problem
Repository has no setup instructions. Users cannot figure out how to install or use bv. Ref: GH issue #1.

## Implementation Plan

### README Sections to Add
1. Overview: What bv does (graph-aware triage engine for beads projects)
2. Prerequisites: Rust toolchain, a beads project with .beads/beads.jsonl
3. Installation: cargo install from source, binary download from releases
4. Quick Start: Basic commands to get started
5. Usage Modes:
   - Interactive TUI: bv (launches TUI -- NEVER use from agents)
   - Robot mode: bv --robot-triage, --robot-next, --robot-plan, etc.
   - Export: bv --export-graph output.html
6. Configuration: Any config files, env vars
7. Integration with br: How bv reads from .beads/beads.jsonl
8. Command Reference: Table of all --robot-* commands with descriptions
9. jq Quick Reference: Common jq filters for robot output

### Files to Modify
- README.md (add all sections above)

### Testing Plan

#### Verification Script (new: scripts/verify_docs.sh)
1. Parse each code example from README.md
2. For examples that don't require a beads project: run them, verify they work
3. For bv --help: verify all documented commands appear in help output
4. For bv --robot-*: verify each documented command produces valid JSON
5. Verify all mentioned file paths exist
6. Verify installation instructions work: cargo build --release
7. Log all output with timestamps
8. Report PASS/FAIL per check

### Edge Cases
- README should note that bare bv launches TUI (blocks non-interactive sessions)
- Document minimum beads.jsonl format required
- Note that bv assumes a single repo context
